definition: subsidence/caving in/fig. stranded/lost (in contemplation, daydreams etc)
to submerge/to immerse/to sink/to keep down/to lower/to drop/deep/profound/heavy
pitfall/trap/to get stuck/to sink/to cave in/to frame (false charge)/to capture (a city in battle)/to fall (to the enemy)/defect

sentences.english: The ground subsidence was due to collapse of loess soil caused by applying irrigation water.
sentences.chinese: 地表沉陷是由灌溉水的充填引起黃土結構崩塌造成的。

sentences.english: Yet, it can't be well adapted to the uneven sinking of foundation, easy to be broken.
sentences.chinese: 但對地基不均勻沉陷的適應能力較差，易斷裂。

sentences.english: Subsidence and landslides were observed in Sumatra .
sentences.chinese: 沉陷和山體滑坡，觀察在蘇門答臘。

sentences.english: The earthquake made the roadbed cave in.
The deformation of ruptured rock mass is the mostly causation of ground subsidence over goaf.
sentences.chinese: 廢棄採空區破裂巖體變形是導致地表沉陷的主要原因。

sentences.english: We will accelerate the trial to transform the economies of cities that are dependent on resources that are now depleted and efforts to control sinkholes in coalmining areas.
sentences.chinese: 加快資源枯竭型城市經濟轉型試點和採煤沉陷區治理。

definition: to collapse (of building, dam or bridge)
so deep one cannot see to the bottom/limitless
Shenkeng township in New Taipei City 新北市[Xin1 bei3 shi4], Taiwan
